column1: '''''yanta''''' is a noun meaning "bridge" or "yoke" in [[Quenya]].<ref name="Names">{{App
column2: Letters}}, Note, ''The names of the letters''</ref>
left]]''Yanta'' is the name in [[Quenya]] of the thirty-fifth letter of the [[Tengwar]] alphabet.<ref name="Names"/>  In most modes it is used as a consonant and represents '''Y'''.<ref>{{App
column3: Letters}}, Note, ''The additional letters''</ref>  However, in the [[Mode of Beleriand]], as seen as in the inscription on the [[Doors of Durin
column5: II4}}</ref>  The Westron name for this letter is '''''Ai'''''.<ref>See [[Westron Tengwar]]</ref>

column1: <!-- An extra blank line is needed to prevent the Etymology title from being indented. -->
The word derives from the [[Primitive Quendian]] [[Sundocarme
